title: Lexotanil 3MG Tab 3x10 (L)
details:
Lexotanil tablet generic name is Bromazepam, and its basic formula is a benzodiazepine. It is basically an anti-anxiety tablet and releases stress and anxiety and provides calm to your mind, especially at night. Doctors also recommend the tablet

READ MORE
precautions: To avoid and lessen the harmful effects of the Lexotanil tablet, you must follow some precautionary measures. Some are listed belowDo not use the medicine on your own unless advised by the doctor.You must tell the doctor about your medical history before using the medicine that is about your allergies, other medications or any other disease or condition you are going through.Do not use alcohol while you are taking Lexotanil as this can cause a serious reaction, and the medicine can prove ineffective.Do not exceed the recommended dose as this may lead you to become physically or psychologically dependent on this medicine.Do inform the doctor right away if you face any adverse effects after taking the tablet which included any allergic reaction, breathing difficulty, drowsiness, diarrhoea, headache or irregular heart pulses.To avoid the inactiveness caused by medicine, you must exercise regularly, sleep properly and take a healthy diet.Do not give to children under 18 years of age.Do not miss your recommended dose and in case you do take it as soon as you remember it. But do not take a double dose to compensate for the missed one.It is recommended that you take medicine empty stomach at least half an hour or an hour before having a meal.Do not suddenly leave-taking Lexotanil if you are suffering from epilepsy as it will do significant harm.
effects: It is a common fact that all medicines have some adverse effects also which we call side effects. Bromazepam medicines have many side effects. Some Lexotanil side effects are listed below so you should be mindful while you are taking this drugDrowsiness and being tired.Lightheadedness is you may not feel that you are fainting while you are up or doing some work. The condition improves as soon as you lie down. Nightmares Weakness in muscles.Rare symptoms also include headache, dry mouth and stomach upset, which may cause loose stools, vomiting and cramps in the stomach.Slurred speech that is you may have trouble speaking smoothly, you may slow unconsciously while speaking or your words may be garbled.Blurred vision is another observed change that occurs in some consumers of this tablet.Irregular heartbeats may also occur, which may cause fast or pounding impulses.Urinary problem is rather a common one. You will notice that after taking the Lexotanil tablet, you have an increase in the frequency you to urinate. Memory issues are also observed in several patients, along with a lack of attentiveness and confusion. A study on different drugs concluded that Lexotanil affected learning capacities.Prolonged use of Lexotanil may result in the total dependence of this drug, along with other ailments and harmful consequences. And after you discontinue the medicine after the recommended period, you can face severe anxiety attacks even more than you get before using the medicine.

Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of personal or family history of bipolar disorder, personal or family history of suicide attempts, heart disease (e.g., irregular heartbeat, heart attack), liver disease, kidney disease, blood pressure problems, personal or family history of glaucoma (angle-closure type). Take this medication by mouth, usually once or twice daily after a meal or snack or as directed by your doctor. If drowsiness is a problem and you are taking 1 dose daily, take it at bedtime. If you are taking 2 doses each day, it may help to take 1 of the doses at bedtime. Follow your doctor's directions carefully. Take this medication exactly as prescribed. Do not increase your dose or take this medication more often than prescribed. Your condition will not improve any faster, and the risk of serious side effects may be increased. Taking MAO inhibitors with this medication may cause a serious (possibly fatal) drug interaction. Avoid taking MAO inhibitors (isocarboxazid, linezolid, methylene blue, moclobemide, phenelzine, procarbazine, rasagiline, safinamide, selegiline, tranylcypromine) during treatment with this medication. Most MAO inhibitors should also not be taken for two weeks before and after treatment with this medication. Ask your doctor when to start or stop taking this medication.

details: This medication is used to treat depression. It may help to improve your mood, appetite, and energy level as well as decrease anxiety and insomnia related to depression.
precautions: Before taking it, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or to nefazodone; or if you have any other allergies. Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of personal or family history of bipolar disorder, personal or family history of suicide attempts, heart disease (e.g., irregular heartbeat, heart attack), liver disease, kidney disease, blood pressure problems, personal or family history of glaucoma (angle-closure type). Take this medication by mouth, usually once or twice daily after a meal or snack or as directed by your doctor. If drowsiness is a problem and you are taking 1 dose daily, take it at bedtime. If you are taking 2 doses each day, it may help to take 1 of the doses at bedtime. Follow your doctor's directions carefully. Take this medication exactly as prescribed. Do not increase your dose or take this medication more often than prescribed. Your condition will not improve any faster, and the risk of serious side effects may be increased. Taking MAO inhibitors with this medication may cause a serious (possibly fatal) drug interaction. Avoid taking MAO inhibitors (isocarboxazid, linezolid, methylene blue, moclobemide, phenelzine, procarbazine, rasagiline, safinamide, selegiline, tranylcypromine) during treatment with this medication. Most MAO inhibitors should also not be taken for two weeks before and after treatment with this medication. Ask your doctor when to start or stop taking this medication.

The essential Cymbalta capsules precautions are listed below.Do not use Cymbalta capsules if you have a known allergy to any of its ingredients.Do not use the capsules if you have liver or kidney disorder.Do not use the capsules if you consume monoamine oxidase inhibitor or have taken it within the last 2 weeks.Inform your doctor before using the capsules if you are taking fluvoxamine or other medicine to treat anxiety and depression.Inform your doctor if you have bipolar disorder, seizures, eye disorder, or bleeding disorder.Notify your doctor if your blood sodium levels are low.You might experience suicidal thoughts as the medication takes at least 2 weeks to produce its result. It is recommended to consult a doctor immediately if you experience suicidal thoughts or harm yourself. title: Brintellix 10MG Tab 2x7 (L)
details: This medication is used to treat depression
precautions: Before using this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist your medical history, especially of personal or family history of bipolar/manic-depressive disorder. Antidepressant medications are used to treat a variety of conditions, including depression and other mental/mood disorders. These medications can help prevent suicidal thoughts/attempts and provide other important benefits. However, studies have shown that a small number of people (especially people younger than 25) who take antidepressants for any condition may experience worsening depression, other mental/mood symptoms, or suicidal thoughts/attempts. Therefore, it is very important to talk with the doctor about the risks and benefits of antidepressant medication (especially for people younger than 25), even if treatment is not for a mental/mood condition. Tell the doctor right away if you notice worsening depression/other psychiatric conditions, unusual behavior changes (including possible suicidal thoughts/attempts), or other mental/mood changes (including new/worsening anxiety, panic attacks, trouble sleeping, irritability, hostile/angry feelings, impulsive actions, severe restlessness, very rapid speech). Be especially watchful for these symptoms when a new antidepressant is started or when the dose is changed. It is unknown if this drug passes into breast milk. Consult your doctor before breast-feeding. Some products that may interact with this drug include other drugs that can cause bleeding/bruising (including antiplatelet drugs such as clopidogrel, NSAIDs such as ibuprofen, "blood thinners" such as warfarin/dabigatran). Please consult your doctor when taking this medicine if you are pregnant.
effects: Nausea, constipation, vomiting, dizziness, decreased interest in sex, and changes in sexual ability may occur.
